Opened in 2006, the 8,000-square meter Xinyi District bookstore is Taiwan's largest bookstore and carries a wide selection of books. The bookstore is divided into subjects for easy browsing. Readers are welcome to read books in designated areas.

The Taiwan Handicraft Promotion Center is housed in a plain looking white building, but the displays inside are anything but pedestrian. The center exhibits and sells Taiwan's most extensive selection of fine traditional handicrafts, making it easy to find that perfect gift for home.
09：00~18：00; Closed during the Lunar New Year holiday

column2: Vie Show Cinemas - Taipei Xinyi 威秀影城
column3:
Vie Show Cinemas Taipei Xinyi is a fantastic choice for those who wish to enjoy a great movie amid their hectic schedules. To meet the audience’s need for audio-visual enjoyments, it employed the latest technologies to establish a revolutionary set of standards for multiplex design, which is a milestone in Taiwan’s cinema history. The 17 theaters were created by a renowned interior designer and equipped with ultra large, wide and curved screens, as well as the auditorium seating that ensures a spaciousness and comfort in a barrier-free manner. The only THX-certified Taiwanese theater, Vie Show Cinemas Taipei Xinyi presents a world-class sound system to people in northern Taiwan.
 
 Each elaborately designed, tall-back couch seat in the theaters comes with a separate cup holder for beverage containers or popcorn cups. For a romantic twist, all the seats have adjustable arms and can be converted into couple seats.
Business hours subject to movie schedules

column2: SihPing St. Shopping Area 四平陽光商圈
column3: Ganzhou Street is located in the historic Dadaocheng district. This area has historically occupied an important place in Taiwan's tea trade. While many of the tea merchants of old are now gone, it remains a good place to shop for and enjoy some of the world's best tea.

column2: Kao chi (YongKang) 高記 (永康店)
column3:
Fried Pork Buns has become Kao Chi’s hot selling snack since 1949, the secret of hot selling is the natural fermented old dough; therefore, the crust is chewy in taste. When fried pork buns is ordered, Kao Chi will prepare a small pan to fry buns in front of customers, so that, customers can taste the hot, fresh and delicious snack. Others like "Crispy Pastry of Crab Shell Cake", "Roasted Cucian Crap with Green Onion", "Mung Beans Vermicelli in Soup with Oil Tofu" and so on are also traditional taste. Many officials choose "Kao Chi" to feasted foreign guests and that result in a trend of Shanghai style dessert in Taipei.
Mon~Fri 10:00 to 22:30; Weekends 08:30 to 22:30(ordering before 22:0
0)

column3:
A lot of literator also are connoisseurs of culinary art, and Dian Shui Lou's specialist is making the cuisines out of those literators' novels. As a Jiangsu-Zhejiang style Chinese restaurant, Dian Shui Lou not only provides gourmet cuisines but also tries to keep Chinese dining literature and make it alive in the modern world. So when you are enjoying the famous Steam Dumplings with Minced Pork & Crab Roe Meat in Dian Shui Lou, you're actually experiencing the subtle Chinese dining culture.

Taiwan's first SOGO Department Store, the Zhongxiao store sports a Tokyo-made.＂It is Samll World＂ clock above the front gate. The store targets consumers of all ages and interests and is connected to Zhongxiaofuxing subway station and the underground shopping street.
 The Fuxing store specializes in name brands and luxury goods. Spacious shopping floors aim to provide a more comfortable and abundantly stocked shopping arena. Renown architect Li Zuyuan designed the store's green exterior to express the department store's aspiration to become Taipei ＂City Jade＂.

column3:
Hankou Street has the highest density of photography stores in Taiwan. The world famous Photography Street has been helping to realize photographers' dreams and aspirations for over 40 years. Stores offer cameras, camera accessories, and photography manuals for any budget.

Nearly a thousand shops are located in the capacious Living Mall. The mall has a giant sphere structure that in conjunction with the building's L-shaped design suggests the traditional motif of two dragons holding a pearl. It rises 15 floors with high ceilings that add to the spacious feel of this Taipei landmark destination.

Breeze Center is Taipei's first American-style shopping mall that combines shopping, entertainment, and dining areas in one place. Comfortably designed spaces and well-lighted interior make for a relaxing shopping environment.

column3:
If you are entertaining someone hard to please, Yongkang Beef Noodle Soup Restaurant, the favorite of Taipei residents, is the place to go. Its Sichuan-style hot and spicy soup with huge chunks of beef—cooked just to perfection—leaves everyone satisfied. Besides having a large variety of side dishes, the restaurant also serves steamed spare ribs and steamed intestines—another must try! (My Taipei - 2005 Winter)

column2: Shilin Cutter(no stock right now, please contact us) 士林刀(手工刀無現貨，請來電預定)
column3:
A Shilin Cutter is a special type of foldable pocketknife with an eggplant-shaped handle and bamboo-leaf shaped blade. Invented during the Qing period, the knife was originally called a "Pachiran knife" after the Japanese period name for Shilin District, the place of its manufacture. Its current name dates back to the end of World War II. Available in various sizes and designs, this sturdy and sharp pocketknife makes a perfect and practical souvenir.
Daily 09:30 to 22:00; Closed for three days from Lunar New Year Eve
column4: No.74, Dabei Rd., Shilin Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Lao Mian Cheng Lantern Shop 老綿成燈籠
column3:
Lao Mian Cheng first opened its doors on Dihua Street nearly a century ago. The shop originally sold spirit money (burned for offerings) before turning to the lantern trade. Customers can choose from a wide variety of beautifully hand-painted lanterns. The collapsible paper lanterns also make easy-to-pack gifts for home.
Daily 09:00 to 20:00 (Sunday to 18:00)
column4: No. 298, Sec. 1, Dihua St., Datong Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Sheng Ta Chuang
column3:
Family run for two generations, Sheng Ta Chuang is a long-time promoter of calligraphy in Taipei. The company started as a calligraphy supply store and its calligraphy classes have inducted many a student into this art form. In addition to the calligraphy school, the company has established a museum, gallery and auction house for calligraphy and art.
Daily 10:30 to 20:30, Closed for four days from Lunar New Year's Eve

column2: Hong Shihfu Beef Noodles 洪師父牛肉麵
column3:
The owner of this 20-plus-year-old eatery approaches the dining experience with equal shares of fastidiousness and heart. Years of culinary experience and strictly selected choice beef combine to create some of Taipei's most distinctive tasting beef noodles. Hong Shihfu took second place in the 2006 Taipei International Newrow Mian Festival and it came home from the 2007 festival with a double crown.Beef noodles aside, Hong Shihfu is also known for its scallion steamed buns, butter steamed buns, beef wraps and other treats. The house soymilk and coix seed milk are super thick, healthy and packed with flavor.
Mon.-Sun. 11:00~24:00
column4: No.72, Sec. 2, Jianguo N. Rd., Zhongshan Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column3:
With products ranging from computers and cell phones to CDs and books, the Taipei stores of French retailer Fnac add a cultural note to the shopping experience.

column2: Orchid Room, Brother Hotel 兄弟大飯店-蘭花廳
column3:
Brother Hotel’s "Taiwanese Cuisine Orchid Room" will be always the best place for either giving a feast or just having some snakes to taste all kinds of traditional Taiwanese cuisines. From soft and tender Fried Dried Radish Omelet with high nutritive value, Fried Milk Fish, rice porridge, Tainan style peddler noodles, to Orchid Room’s specialties like Sauteed Pig’s Liver, Stirfried Clams with Soy-bean Sauce, and Stir-fried Oysters with Fermented Soybeans are all foodies’ best choices.

column2: Tu Hsiao Yueh Dan-tsu Noodles 度小月擔仔麵
column3:
Founded in Tainan 104 years ago, Tu Hsiao Yueh has brought its traditional flavors north to Taipei. The danzih noodles here are made with minced meat stewed at a high temperature and served with sprouts, dried shrimp, cilantro, pureed garlic and black vinegar. Each small bowl is packed with a distinctive old-time flavor that is also reflected in the restaurant decor.
11:30~23:00, Sunday:11:30~21:30

column2: Ay-Chung Flour-Rice Noodle 阿宗麵線
column3:
Walk down Emei Street and you are bound to see folks holding green bowls of rice noodles from this popular Ximending institution. Ay-Chung's slurpingly smooth noodles are served in a sweet and sour broth flavored with salt cured intestines, skipjack tuna, and shredded bamboo shoots and garnished with cilantro, basil, pureed garlic, and a sprinkle of dark vinegar.
Mon. - Thu. 09:30 - 22:30
Fri. - Sun. 09:30 - 11:00

column2: Hsin Tung Yang 新東陽
column3:
During Taiwan’s era of economic take-off, industry and commerce started to develop, and many food companies sprouted. In 1967, Hsin Tung Yang started to produce and sell processed meat products. The Company’s earliest operation location was at the current retail shop on Wuchang Street, called the “Hsin Tung Yang Barbecue Meat Company”, whose main business is wholesale.
 
 Hsin Tung Yang adheres to quality assurance, and is the first company in Taiwan to be awarded the international ISO-9001 certification and superior meat logo from the Taiwan Meat Development Foundation, which shows their effort in ensuring the freshness of their products. With the goals of refining and internationalizing Chinese cuisine, and continuously upgrading through production technology, operation and management, marketing and research and development, Hsin Tung Yang flourishes and has established a worldwide reputation, laying the global foundation for Taiwan’s food industry development.
 
 The wide variety of products ranges from bacon, meat floss to barbecued meat, which are all familiar to everybody. The meat floss is fluffy but not greasy, and one can smell the rich aroma upon opening the packages; the barbequed meat is very springy, not too dry, and very juicy, and has a smooth and tender mouth feel; other products such as pineapple cake, meat sauce, canned food, etc., also carry Hsin Tung Yang’s unique flavor, and Hsin Tung Yang has also come out with many new tasty flavors.
 Mai’s barbeque meat, named after the Company’s boss, is an authentic Hong Kong style barbeque meat self-made by Hsin Tung Yang. It has a unique sweet flavor.
Daily 09:00-21:30
column4: No. 20-1, Sec. 1, Wuchang St., Zhongzheng Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Formosa Chang 鬍鬚張美食文化館
column3:
Once a solitary food stall next to Shuanglian Market, Formosa Chang has grown into an international chain with 29 restaurants in Taiwan and four in Japan. The house specialty is Taiwanese-style soy stewed meats served on rice. The restaurant's trademark dish won the "Most Popular Award" at the 9th Taipei Traditional Food Carnival. This is a good spot for an authentic taste of local cuisine.
Daily 10:00~01:30
column4: No. 62, Ningsia Rd., Datong Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column3:
Acclaimed as “Taipei's Best Shanghainese Restaurant”, Shanghai Pavilion offers a wide variety of palatable creations and an excellent selection of both Chinese and Western liquors and teas. Connoisseurs of fine dining are guaranteed a delightful culinary experience, contemporary surroundings, and unparalleled views of Taipei City.

column2: Chili House Restaurant
column3:
Over half a century, Chili House Restaurant, just like an old friend, provides you the genuine Si-Chuan cuisines with the warmest hospitality. Take the Wantons (dumplings) in Red Chili Oil, the best selling at Chili House Restaurant for 5,000 pieces a day, as an example, the red chili oil and sauce always need to be prepared for 4-5 hours for their daily use. But Chili House Restaurant not only keeps the Si-Chuan genuine flavor in their menu but also develop many new dishes for satisfying the young generation and metropolitan.

column2: Kuo Yuan Ye 郭元益
column3:
Founded over a century ago, this family-run bakery has grown into a hugely successful 31-store chain. In the 1990s, the bakery added western baked goods to its product offerings. Its western cookie gift sets pioneered new ground in Taiwan's wedding cookie market and also won Kuo Yuan Ye the "Top-10 National Design Award" in 1993. Since 2003, the bakery has been picked six consecutive times as the top "Ideal Brand" by Management magazine. Kuo Yuan Ye also took third-place in the creative category of a citywide pineapple cake competition.
Daily 09:30~21:30
column4: No. 546, Wenlin Rd., Shilin Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Hai Pa Wang Restaurant (flagship branch) 海霸王旗艦店
column3:
The flagship branch of Hai Pa Wang Restaurant at the intersection of Zhongshan N. Rd. and Minzu E. Rd. features a 9,900 m2 interior designed by a British artist. Among the restaurant’s modernist details, the picture windows offer a view of the Grand Hotel in the distance, which is particularly dazzling at sunset! 
The ground-floor “Gold Medal Hot Pot” promises to meet your gastronomic needs with delicate soups, in addition to a colorful array of seafood and meat options. 
On the second floor, a seafood buffet is known for a collection of salads as well as international cuisines. Also available in Hai Pa Wang are lobsters, shark fins and abalones of the best quality and the most authentic Taiwanese delicacies; catering services are available at any location you desire. 
A perfect venue for wedding receptions, the restaurant offers newlywed couples a comprehensive “dream wedding” package with qualified facilities and attending staff. 
Weekdays: 11:30-14:00, 17:30-21:30
Weekends: 11:00-14:00, 17:00-21:30
column4: No. 59, Sec. 3, Zhongshan N. Rd., Zhongshan Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Beef Restaurant 牛店牛肉麵
column3:
From its frescoes of cattle to its wood and stone design, Beef Restaurant’s interior design leaves people gaping. Its light soup not only does not have an oily taste, but it possesses an uniquely pleasant aroma. Its signature dish, "Manhan Beef Noodle Soup,” fills your bowl with beef, beef tendon and beef stomach – a portion size certain to leave you satisfied. Those who enjoy strong flavors can add the restaurant’s special spicy beef marrow sauce. Simply delectable! (My Taipei - 2005 Winter)
Tue ~ Sun 11:30-21:00, Closed on Mondays.
column4: No.91, Kunming St, Wanhua Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Laotienlu 上海老天祿食品滷味
column3:
It originally served Shanghai snacks and pickie foods. Now it serves the braised foods by stewing 14 kinds of herbs and double cooking. After stewing, meats are cooled down immediately to absorb the herb flavor so that it tastes more chewy.
Mon.-Sun.10:00-21:00
column4: No. 56, Chengdu Rd., Wanhua Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Miramar Cinemas (Dazhi) 美麗華大直影城
column3:
When high-resolution IMAX films are projected onto a theater screen, they produce a picture quality that is extraordinarily crystal-clear and natural. Such images generate a greater sense of reality as they remain perfectly projected and strikingly intense, without looking coarse or grainy, onto a screen 10 times larger than the usual 35mm ones. IMAX theaters at their inception mostly showed educational films: natural science, technologies, environmental protection, zoology, geography and culture. A good example of such a theatre is the Space Theater at Taichung’s National Museum of Natural Science.
 
 Miramar Cinemas spent nearly NT$ 270 million on the IMAX theater project that includes 100% wool carpeting and a 22-meter-high vaulted ceiling. With its crimson base tone accentuated with amber-hued streamlined LED lights, the theater interior looks stately and opulent. Miramar Cinemas devised its sound-proof equipment according to the strictest standards, making it 2 to 3 times more effective than a typical theater. The 21.16-meter-tall, 28.8-meter-wide multiplex screens come in curved and rectangular shapes to avoid any blind spots. They are painted silver to give the audience a mindboggling visual impact with all the images reflected right onto them.
Business hours subject to movie schedules
column4: 6/F, No. 22, Jingye 3rd Rd., Zhongshan Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Mu Ji Beef Noodles 穆記牛肉麵館
column3:
Legend has it that the beef noodle recipe of this popular establishment was secreted out of the Qing imperial kitchen by a chef who scribbled it on his shirt. Though the story is subject to doubt, there is no question that Mu Ji's beef noodles are fit for a king. The hand-rolled noodles are topped with a generous portion of chewy beef. Both the stewed and braised varieties are sure to satisfy. The restaurant is also known for its beef buns.
Open daily 11:00-21:00
column4: 1F., No.239, Wuxing St., Xinyi Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Celestial Restaurant 天廚菜館
column3:
The high-quality and delicate cuisine with regular price is the reason why Celestial Restaurant can be so popular among customers and had won so many awards. "Peking Roasted Duck" is using traditional skills inherited from the experienced chef, and the crispy skin and juicy flesh make this delicacy become the specialty of Celestial Restaurant. Besides, customers can experience, too, the chef’s authentic culinary skills by enjoying those delicate and popular dishes like “Fried Shredded Chicken with Peas”.
Daily am11:00-14:00、pm17:00-21:00，Closed:The Dragon Festival, The Moon Festival
column4: 3F., No. 1, Nanjing W. Rd., Zhongshan Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Kenting Dan Dan Bubble Milk Tea 墾丁蛋蛋ㄉㄨㄞ奶
column3:
Standing on a busy street corner near National Taiwan University, Kenting Dan Dan Bubble Milk Tea draws much attention with its funny store name as well as youthful decorative details, including the walls covered in black spots reminiscent of cows. Such creative ideas helped to make it a most distinctive brand image.
 
 Although its competitors mushroomed during the “Pearl Milk Tea craze”, Kenting Dan Dan adopted brown sugar and fresh milk in its recipe, knowing that only those dare to innovate will survive. Rich in calcium, iron and minerals, the low-calorie brown sugar is now a popular beverage ingredient, and the fresh milk provides a natural, tasty source of nutrition. The best-sellers at Kenting Dan Dan not only quench the summer thirst with herbal jelly, mung beans and red beans, but they also ensure good health.
Opening Hours: Sun-Thu, 11:30AM-10:30PM; Fri-Sat 11:30AM-11:30PM
column4: No. 165, Section 3, Tingzhou Rd., Zhongzheng Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Dalai Braised Pork Rice Eatery 大來小館(永康店)
column3:
11:00-21:30 everyday
Dalai Eatery has not only won the first prize in braised pork rice, but its other dishes have also won praise from food lovers. It is a good choice for simple dining or hosting a banquet. Its dishes include: stuffed eggplant with meat, stewed cabbage with plaice, braised pork trotter, intestine, pig belly, garlic oyster, etc.; other signature dishes such as crispy squid rolls, steamed clam with melon, fried milkfish belly, fried garlic sprouts with dried shrimp, fried Chinese chives with dried shrimp, etc, are just some of the numerous dishes highly recommended. Smart food lovers will let the boss recommend the dishes, and just sit back to enjoy the wonderfully prepared food.
column4: No.2, Lane 7, Yongkang Street (Yongkang Branch), Da'an Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Shanghai Court, Hyatt Hotel Taipei 臺北君悅酒店-雲錦中餐廳
column3:
The classic Shanghai cuisines are strongly promoted by Shanghai Court of Hyatt Hotel Taipei; and the chef’s best recommendations will be the "Pot-sticker-like Bean Curd Sheet with Fried Duck and Wild Mushrooms” which uses fried duck and wild mushrooms as fillings to be wrapped by bean curd sheets and tastes both crispy and tender. The other creative dish "Cabbage and Roasted Wheat Glutens Stuffed with Chopped Streaky Pork" is also popular and admirable in Shanghai Court that even if the gourmand will praise it pretty highly.
Daily11:30-14:30；18:00-21:30
column4: 2F., No.2, Songshou Rd., Xinyi Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Brother Hotel (Plum Blossom Room) 兄弟大飯店-梅花廳
column3:
The Plum Blossom Room of Brother Hotel, a Cantonese restaurant, attracts a loyal customer base and tourists that leave it packed during business hours.
 
 Served on pushcarts in a genuine style of Cantonese High Tea, the colorful dim sum options available at Plum Blossom Room include shrimp dumplings, seafood rolls and crab roe shumai. Among the best-sellers are deep-fried shrimp rolls, rice noodle rolls, roasted cabbage, and juicy seafood-stuffed buns, a must-try.
 
 For those planning to throw banquets, engagement parties, or wedding receptions, the restaurant offers Taiwan abalone with scallops, crab and shark fin stew, lobster, and various other dishes for any desired menu combination.
Daily 09:00-21:30 (dessert available till 20:30)

Sichuan-style stewed beef ramen and spicy beef ramen are the best sellers at this long-time establishment. Big servings and low prices have won the shop a loyal clientele, so empty seats are generally hard to find. The spicy beef ramen, made with Chinese cabbage and a sweet, peppery flavor, is a particular favorite of female patrons.

column2: Cinemark 喜滿客影城
column3:
Cinemark is located within Living Mall as the first multiplex co-founded by Cinemark International L.L.C and Core Pacific Group in Taiwan. With screens of just the right size and Dolby SRD-EX6.1, the audience is promised an intense sense of reality. Cinemark attaches great importance to sanitation and adopts an air-conditioning system that includes the UV-C Sanitizing Light, besides an independent anti-germ system enabled by a photocatalyst and nanotechnology.
 
 This multiplex comprises 13 theaters, including a VIP theater and a digital theater. The U.S.-imported, ultra-large luxury seating in the digital theater offers lots of elbow and leg room, with the seats spaced skillfully to ensure unblocked views. Moreover, each of the luxury seats has a dining table attached to it for extra comfort. While the VIP Lounge and independent entrances/exits remind people of a first-class flight, they provide an effective solution to the overwhelming crowds when the movie ends. A friendly service staff sells popcorn made with mustard seed oil, Churros, beverages and the other terrific snacks for movies. Customers will receive discounts on parking by presenting the ticket stub, which is quite an amenity for people in parking-space- strapped Taipei City.
column4: (within Living Mall) B1, No. 138, Section 4, Bade Rd., Songshan Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Meimen SJT 梅門食踐堂
column3:
The dishes of “Meimen SJT” are prepared meticulously. Every dish has a story behind it, and every recipe is personally prepared by Master Li Feng-Shan, who makes use of seasonal ingredients.
 
 Adhering to the traditional ancient cooking method, and emphasizing yin and yang harmony and the functioning of the five elements, it is intended for easy digestion and body absorption. The only four seasonings used are salt, vinegar, soy sauce and sesame oil, completely presenting the original flavor of the raw ingredients; emphasizing healthy eating through delicacies.
 
 All dishes are named with a cause, and explained by kung fu experts at the scene, allowing customers to savor the delicacies, and let their thoughts carry them to higher levels.
Sun-Thu 11:00-22:00
Fri-Sat 11:00-22:30
Located in the European-style BELLAVITA, “Meimen SJT” fuses the classic with the fashionable, and presents the exquisite and profound history of Chinese dietary culture in a modern style, allowing you to span the barriers of time and space to enjoy the essence of ancient and modern cuisine.
column4: B2, No. 28, Songren Rd., Xinyi Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Zhang's Seafood From Turtle Island 小張龜山島
column3:
If there is a doubt about which fish or seafood is a better choice, only a fisherman can tell the difference. Mr. Zhang, the former fisherman and now the owner and chef of Zhang's Seafood from Turtle Island, personally selects the seafood everyday from the port of Yilan, then prepares their special cuisines by himself. Because the freshness and limited quantity of seafood available each day, people need to get Zhang’s shop early to order. If somebody would like know the real fresh taste of shrimps, try the "Raw Sweet Shrimp", which is Mr. Zhang's favorite.
Mon.-Sun./Holiday pm16:00-am02:00
column4: No.73, Liaoning St., Zhongshan Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Yuan Rong Fang 圓融坊panapina
column3:
Fabrics, ceramics and other handmade handicrafts are enticingly displayed on antique furniture pieces at Yuan Rong Fang. The embroidered and beaded items here are locally made by hand and have a classical elegance and beauty.
Daily 11:00 to 21:00; Closed for five days from Lunar New Year Eve

column2: Old Hsiung's Beef Noodle Soup 老熊牛肉麵店
column3:
The proprietor of this popular beef noodle soup shop is a Sichuan native, so the house specialty is suitably spicy. Old Hsiung has taken a recipe heavy on chili and Sichuan peppers and modified it into a crowd-winning concoction without sacrificing any of the goodness of the original recipe. One of the must-try offerings on the menu is Sichuan style stewed beef needle soup. The broth is a bit spicy, and the noodles have a homemade taste of wheat. The lean beef cubes are from local Taiwan cows and packed with flavor. If you like hot, this is your spot.
Mon~Sat 11:00~20:00; Sun 11:00~15:00
column4: No. 38-2, Nanhai Rd., Zhongzheng Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: A-Jiao’s Restaurant 阿嬌的店
column3:
A-Jiao's Restaurant sets in the ordinary neighborhood. It seemed like a private club without the luxury, whereas the dining area is classical Chinese theme with a hint of modern design. A-Jiao’s cuisines are also unique, and none of them can be found anywhere else. All of the recipes are made without deep-fry or stir-fry; just like "Stewed Jade Gourd", A-Jiao's classical speciality, which needs to be cooked slowly for over 10 hours. By reservation only, you'll be touched with A-Jiao's gourmet and healthy cuisines.
Tue.-Sun./Holiday pm12:00-14:30/16:00-21:00, Closed:Mon.
column4: 4F., No.220, Guangming Rd., Beitou Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Riverside 河岸留言
column3:
For seven years, the Riverside has been serving up some of Taipei's best live music from a basement next to the Taipower Building in the Gongguan area. The owner, Lin Cheng-ju, is an experience guitarist with a passion for music. The Riverside has held over 4,500 performances over the years, catching many local acts making their first baby steps to stardom. Novice musicians can also test out their skills during the weekly open jam session on Mondays.
19:00 ~ 00:30
column4: B1, No. 2, Lane 244, Sec. 3, Roosevelt Rd., Zhongzheng Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Shaoshaoke 勺勺客陝西料理
column3:
This is the place makes people feel like being the countryside at the desert of the northwest China. The decors, the foods, and the drinks are all copied from the real northwest life of China. Shaoshaoke even adopts the original cooking methods to prepare the beef and lamb dishes, and provides the famous "Dice of Piece Cake with Mutton or Beef Soup", the daily meal of the northwest people, which is made with beef stock and dozens of Chinese herbs and seasonings, and served with some special bread.
Tue.Sun/Holiday 11:30-14:30,17:30-22:00,Closed on Mon.

column2: MRT Zhongshan Station Area 捷運中山站街區
column3: This area used to be a hot spot for Americans; now it is also a popular gathering area for the Japanese. There are creative snappy little boutiques scattered in the alleys. A few Japanese anime-themed KTVs have also sprung up in recent years. The area surrounding Zhongshan North Road and Nanjing West Road is filled with original workshops and designer studios. Serene but diverse in style, the area is perfect for a leisurely stroll along the alleys, and experiencing adventures during a creative exploration. If you turn onto the alley from “SPOT - Taipei Film House” and walk towards the Taipei Museum of Contemporary Art, refurbished from an old building, on Chang’an West Road, you will see many stylish hair salons, as well as boutiques, such as “Mogu”, “Lovely Taiwan”, etc. perfect for cute and Taiwanese-chic gifts.

column2: WangTea Shop 有記名茶
column3:
“The warmth of charcoal that brings about the aroma of tea leaves gives rise to the century-old story of a conscientious and fashionable tea shop!” Based in Dadaocheng, Taipei, the starting point of the world-famous Taiwan tea, WangTea Shop has been in operation for more than a hundred years, processing and selling teas grown in different parts of Taiwan, and is renown for its philosophy of running an honest business.

column2: Ambassador Theatres 國賓影城
column3:
Accommodating up to 1,514 people in a total of 6 theaters, the Ambassador Theatres in Breeze Center boast luxury, ergonomic and spacious seating complete with cup holders for popcorn containers or beverages. Highlights of Ambassador’s equipment include: the U.S.-imported, professional-grade Strong theater system, DPI1/2K digital theater system, Dolby SRD-EX, DTS-ES, the ultra-wide and the curved Harkness Hall sound screen that promise movie viewers a sense of reality.
 
 Good news for those who are afraid of parking problems that keep them late for movies: 3-hours free parking is available upon presenting an Ambassador ticket stub that proves same-day movie viewing either on weekdays or after 9:00 PM on weekends/holidays. During the other time periods of the week, those who hold Ambassador ticket stubs won’t have to worry about parking in the east end of Taipei either, as they are offered a 50% discount for 4 hours. Various other discounts are also available for holders of the Ambassador A+ Card or Happy Go Card. For a visual extravaganza, just catch a box-office hit and enjoy movie-themed sweepstakes at Breeze Center!
Business hours begin at 10:30 AM Monday to Sunday; 1:00 AM on weekends/ holidays
column4: 7/F, No. 39, Section 1, Fuxing South Rd., Songshan Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: eslite Bookstore Dunnan Branch 誠品敦南店
column3:
Can a bookstore be a tourist attraction? eslite Bookstore Dunnan Branch is that unique.
 
 Open 24 hours a day and offering a complete range of newly-published books, Eslite Bookstore Dunnan Branch is a unique part of Taipei's cultural landscape, and attracts throngs of tourists. It has also been the subject of in-depth reports by the domestic and foreign media, including Britain's BBC, France's Fifth Channel, and Japan's Fuji TV. Perhaps as a result of this media coverage, vast numbers of Taipei tourists make a pilgrimage to the eslite Bookstore Dunnan Branch.
 
   The bookstore contains approximately 230,000 books of many types in both Chinese and foreign languages. The bookstore's various floors also house artistic and cultural activities, intriguing stationary, popular music, fashion items, cultural creativity design products, and a food court with thematic restaurants and publications. As a result, this is not exclusively a bookstore, but is rather a fascinating, wildly-diverse platform for cultural creativity and cultural undertakings.
 
   Dubbed "Asia's best bookstore" by TIME Magazine, the eslite Bookstore Dunnan Branch is an inconspicuous resident of an office tower by day, but becomes a gleaming pearl in Taipei's Eastern District by night. We recommend you pay a visit to the bookstore at night to truly appreciate its wonderful feast of knowledge!
column4: No.245, Sec. 1, Dunhua S. Rd, Da'an Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Mo Zai Yang 莫宰羊
column3:
Since antiquity, lamb was regarded as a macrobiotic treasure in the palace; it nourishes, tones the body and Qi, stimulates the appetite and replenishes strength. It is also beneficial to pregnant women due to its ability to stimulate the mammary gland, reduce leucorrhea and boost the immune system. Moreover, lamb can be consumed all year round. In order to provide consistent meat quality and texture, Mo Zai Yang imports only the finest, zero-pollution lamb from New Zealand and Australia and traditional Taiwanese culinary methods are used to prepare the dish. It can be stir-fried, served cold and with sauce, braised in soy sauce, stewed, grilled, stewed with soy sauce, etc. When complemented by traditional food ingredients and recipes, such as bean paste, salted black beans, noodles and Chinese herbs, many delicious and macrobiotic lamb dishes can be prepared that have proved to be well received among patrons during the past 16 years.
11:00-14:00、17:00~01:00
column4: 28, Sec.3, Xinsheng S. Rd., Da'an Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: BELLAVITA 寶麗廣場
column3:
BELLAVITA, the first mall in Taiwan whose concept is to provide a better life, and unlike the current shopping concept of brand shops and departmental stores, provides a comfortable and cozy lifestyle and space. Its business area spans over 33,000 m2, situated in the trend-setting commercial Xinyi Planning District and transportation hub. The specially designed space and interior, the natural landscaping, the classic branded stores, the exquisite restaurants and the art and humanities environment allow customers to enjoy the various aspects of beauty at a relaxing pace of life.
 
 The concept of BELLAVITA is adopted from the European fashion capital. Its architectural style uses a mixture of natural stones, sunlight, flowing water and plants, combined with a fountain with changing lights, specially planted palm trees from the Middle East and a colorful garden at the atrium. When the sunlight penetrates through the glass and reflects on the shiny water surface, it is indeed a touching moment.
 
 BELLAVITA has a European exterior design; it is a building filled with cultural charm in this new era. It adopts the eastern misty golden peony as the building symbol, which not only represents a strong and prosperous material civilization, but also symbolizes the European coat of arms, inheriting its glorious history and irreplaceable position.
Mon-Thu & Sun 10:30 - 22:00 
Holidays and holiday eves: 10:30 - 22:30
column4: No. 28, Songren Rd., Xinyi Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column3:
The Lovely Taiwan Shop is a place where you can explore the various cultures unique to Taiwan. The shop was founded 4 years ago, displaying and selling a variety of more than 1000 hand-made products, thus providing a long-term stable sales platform for the tribal workers. Site link allow everyone to see the hand-made goods that Taiwan has to offer. The consumer becomes the source of real support for the community/tribal industries. Every dollar spent goes straight back to benefit/ help the community because the Lovely Taiwan Shop participates in Fair Trade of goods. Lovely Taiwan Shop's surpluses are all put into the community/ tribal Industry Development Fund.

The bookstore has established for almost three years which specializes in travel books renting and overseas purchasing by an agent. We make efforts in promoting the independent travel and sharing the travel experiences. We hold the domestic and international travel lecture courses and forums nonscheduled every week. At the same time, we also provide travel advice for you and site lease. We wish everyone in this friendly-free space could speak their mind without reticence so that we can gather more travel lovers. column2: Yuhuahsin Foods Co., Ltd 御華興食品股份有限公司-八德門市
column3:
Yuhuahsin was founded by the first generation of the Su family, Su Zong-Ju, in 1946. It was originally named Huahsin Pastry Shop and was renamed Yuhuahsin Food Co., Ltd. in 1992 for business expansion.Yuhuahsin mainly offered Taiwanese traditional pastries, ritual and festive foods in early years, such as ang ku kuey, longevity peaches, biscuits, pineapple cakes, wedding cakes, Chinese peanuts crispy, Chinese rice crispy, and so on. These products have won the hearts of consumers.Aside from making traditional pastries to pass on Taiwanese culture, we have been making an effort to begin catering services and offer fine delicacies in our bakery shop for the past few years.Yuhuahsin has won the Golden Prize in Creative Dessert Carnival of Taiwan Pastry Exhibition in 2015. We always bake with love and will keep providing high quality products and services to every consumer.

column2: KiKi Szuchuan Cusine KiKi川味餐廳
column3:
Kiki, the name of the young witch from Director Miyazaki's animation movie, now is doing her magic to turn the traditional Szuchuan style dishes into modern gourmet cuisines. Szuchuan style usually means spicy hot, rich taste, and sometimes greasy, but Kiki's chef makes it possible to lower the sodium and oil while keeps the hot and rich taste. Kiki Szuchuan Cuisine also develops new dishes like the "Flies' Heads", the Stir Fried Minced Pork with Chinese Chive & Fermented Black Beans, that always surprised the young generations.

To restore an 80 years old house while maintaining its nostalgic style, HOK offers delicacies combine Taiwanese traditional pastry and Japanese dessert, even transfers French Macaroon and chocolate into fantastic finger foods. It not only presents unique desserts with tea from centenary brand, but also develops tea set and lifestyle accessories with famous culture and creative brand. In HOK, you can enjoy a renewed Taiwanese food culture in a relaxing space.

Its Sichuan-style hot and spicy soup with huge chunks of beef—cooked just to perfection—leaves everyone satisfied. column2: Kuo Yuan Ye 郭元益
column3:
Founded over a century ago, this family-run bakery has grown into a hugely successful 31-store chain. In the 1990s, the bakery added western baked goods to its product offerings. Its western cookie gift sets pioneered new ground in Taiwan's wedding cookie market and also won Kuo Yuan Ye the "Top-10 National Design Award" in 1993. Since 2003, the bakery has been picked six consecutive times as the top "Ideal Brand" by Management magazine. Kuo Yuan Ye also took third-place in the creative category of a citywide pineapple cake competition.

column2: Chili House Restaurant
column3:
Over half a century, Chili House Restaurant, just like an old friend, provides you the genuine Si-Chuan cuisines with the warmest hospitality. Take the Wantons (dumplings) in Red Chili Oil, the best selling at Chili House Restaurant for 5,000 pieces a day, as an example, the red chili oil and sauce always need to be prepared for 4-5 hours for their daily use. But Chili House Restaurant not only keeps the Si-Chuan genuine flavor in their menu but also develop many new dishes for satisfying the young generation and metropolitan.

Fried Pork Buns has become Kao Chi’s hot selling snack since 1949, the secret of hot selling is the natural fermented old dough; therefore, the crust is chewy in taste. When fried pork buns is ordered, Kao Chi will prepare a small pan to fry buns in front of customers, so that, customers can taste the hot, fresh and delicious snack. Others like "Crispy Pastry of Crab Shell Cake", "Roasted Cucian Crap with Green Onion", "Mung Beans Vermicelli in Soup with Oil Tofu" and so on are also traditional taste. Many officials choose "Kao Chi" to feasted foreign guests and that result in a trend of Shanghai style dessert in Taipei.

Once a solitary food stall next to Shuanglian Market, Formosa Chang has grown into an international chain with 29 restaurants in Taiwan and four in Japan. The house specialty is Taiwanese-style soy stewed meats served on rice. The restaurant's trademark dish won the "Most Popular Award" at the 9th Taipei Traditional Food Carnival. column2: Dai Shui Lou 點水樓(南京店)
column3:
A lot of literator also are connoisseurs of culinary art, and Dian Shui Lou's specialist is making the cuisines out of those literators' novels. As a Jiangsu-Zhejiang style Chinese restaurant, Dian Shui Lou not only provides gourmet cuisines but also tries to keep Chinese dining literature and make it alive in the modern world. So when you are enjoying the famous Steam Dumplings with Minced Pork & Crab Roe Meat in Dian Shui Lou, you're actually experiencing the subtle Chinese dining culture.
Daily am11:00-14:30；pm17:30-22:00

Din Tai Fung is well-known for its delicacies； especially dishes like Steamed Pork Dumplings, Steamed Chicken Soup, and Fried Rice with Eggs and Shrimps are classic cuisines with high recommendations. The new developed dishes, ＂Shrimp-and-Pork Wontons in Red Chili Oil＂ and ＂Pork-and-Vegetable Wontons in Red Chili Oil＂, are spicy, delicious, and most important of all, with the scent of Chinese herbal medicine. In recent year, Din Tai Fung keeps computerizing operations to improve their services and efficiency which win them a good reputation in restaurants industry.

column3:
The owner of this 20-plus-year-old eatery approaches the dining experience with equal shares of fastidiousness and heart. Years of culinary experience and strictly selected choice beef combine to create some of Taipei's most distinctive tasting beef noodles. Hong Shihfu took second place in the 2006 Taipei International Newrow Mian Festival and it came home from the 2007 festival with a double crown.Beef noodles aside, Hong Shihfu is also known for its scallion steamed buns, butter steamed buns, beef wraps and other treats. The house soymilk and coix seed milk are super thick, healthy and packed with flavor.

column3:
Located at the Sun Square, this 20-year-old eatery does a thriving business. In addition to its award-winning minced meat on rice dishes, Jinshan reels in diners (and the media coverage) with its delicious shrimp rolls and spareribs on rice.

column2: Duck and Traditional Goose Restaurant 鴨肉扁
column3:
Duck meat was the sole house specialty of this eatery when it first opened in 1950, but after two years of mediocre business the owners added goose to the menu. Business picked up and the restaurant has now been going strong under the management of three generations of family owners. The restaurant uses a local goose variety called "lion goose" or "Taiwan goose." The high-quality meat has a firm texture and fresh taste. The rice and wheat noodle soups here are made with a thick broth of stewed goose and absolutely no MSG.

Brother Hotel’s "Taiwanese Cuisine Orchid Room" will be always the best place for either giving a feast or just having some snakes to taste all kinds of traditional Taiwanese cuisines. From soft and tender Fried Dried Radish Omelet with high nutritive value, Fried Milk Fish, rice porridge, Tainan style peddler noodles, to Orchid Room’s specialties like Sauteed Pig’s Liver, Stirfried Clams with Soy-bean Sauce, and Stir-fried Oysters with Fermented Soybeans are all foodies’ best choices.

column3:
Located next to the ATT and Ming Yao department stores, this shop has been serving up traditional handmade starch ball desserts for over 20 years. Sinfully sweet and generously portioned, these treats are made with the best ingredients and no artificial flavoring. As a testimony to its uncompromising attitude to quality, the shop won the "ROC Consumers Association Golden Award" and "Customer Satisfaction Gold Award."

The Citystar group operates another dim sum eatery called Luckstar as well as a Japanese restaurant called Yu Fu In. High-end service, reasonable prices, made-to-order dishes, and fresh ingredients have all contributed to the restaurant's success.

Pearl Liang Chinese Seafood Restaurant of Hyatt Hotel Taipei interprets Cantonese cuisines creatively and innovatively. The chef’s recommendation "Steamed Shrimp Balls Bundled with Ham and Salted Duck Yolk" contains the essence of Cantonese cuisine: daintily, crispy, delicate and tender tastes. Other specialties like "Bean Curd with Elm Fungus and Mushrooms", "Boiled Abalone with Chinese Yam and Sesame Sauce", and "Stir-Fried Salted Beef Tenderloin with Pineapple and Ginger", truly represent the delicate and dainty of Cantonese cuisines, and give gourmets a distinctive experience.

column3:
Founded in Tainan 104 years ago, Tu Hsiao Yueh has brought its traditional flavors north to Taipei. The danzih noodles here are made with minced meat stewed at a high temperature and served with sprouts, dried shrimp, cilantro, pureed garlic and black vinegar. Each small bowl is packed with a distinctive old-time flavor that is also reflected in the restaurant decor.

Singer-actor Wakin Chau brought all of the flavors from his native Guangdong to this Cantonese restaurant venture. Seasonal dishes, well-balanced flavors and healthy ingredients are the trademarks of this popular Taipei eatery. The dried shrimp rice rolls and steamed fish are house specialties. Make sure to also try the rice hot pot with cured meats and the enticing dim sum selections.

This Victorian-themed teahouse chain was founded by a person with a passion for roses. If you want to enjoy English-style high tea is an ambiance of quiet elegance, Rose House is the place to go in Taipei.

The beef broth is cooked slowly at very fine flame for the whole day. The broth looks clear but well reserves all the vegetables and beef's flavor, and most important of all is Hong-Pai only uses the local beef for their beef noodles, that's why Hong-Pai was voted the first place for the best beef noodles at internet in 2007. Besides, both the Dumplings in Red Chili Oil and the Baked Wheat Rolls (known locally as Shaobing) with beef are also popular items at Hong-Pai, so people always like to buy them home and share with friends and families.

It mainly serves traditional Taiwanese popular dishes. The rice mixed with pork oil has a memorable smell because of using high quality oil. In addition, the uncommon Yilan ancient braised pork and fry pork liver are greatly recomended.

column2: Yin Yih Restaurant 銀翼餐廳
column3:
300 years ago, monk Wensi prepared a delicious tofu dish for the Empire. Now Yin Yih Restaurant represents this Monk Wensi Tofu with the state of art culinary skill to shred 4 square inches tofu into almost 5,000 strips, and cook with chicken, bamboo shoots, and Chinese ham.
 
 By serving the original recipes to celebrities and public, Yin Yih Restaurant, opened since 1947, has always been the best place where people looking for traditional and formal banquet of Chinese delicacies.

column2: Hai Pa Wang Restaurant (flagship branch) 海霸王旗艦店
column3:
The flagship branch of Hai Pa Wang Restaurant at the intersection of Zhongshan N. Rd. and Minzu E. Rd. features a 9,900 m2 interior designed by a British artist. Among the restaurant’s modernist details, the picture windows offer a view of the Grand Hotel in the distance, which is particularly dazzling at sunset! 
The ground-floor “Gold Medal Hot Pot” promises to meet your gastronomic needs with delicate soups, in addition to a colorful array of seafood and meat options. 
On the second floor, a seafood buffet is known for a collection of salads as well as international cuisines. Also available in Hai Pa Wang are lobsters, shark fins and abalones of the best quality and the most authentic Taiwanese delicacies; catering services are available at any location you desire. 
A perfect venue for wedding receptions, the restaurant offers newlywed couples a comprehensive “dream wedding” package with qualified facilities and attending staff. 
Weekdays: 11:30-14:00, 17:30-21:30
Weekends: 11:00-14:00, 17:00-21:30

column3:
Its chefs are trained in the classical Hakka cuisine and adjust to customers' favors. Stir-fry Squid is one of recommended appetizers, which the squid tastes pliable but strong. Hakka salty riceball soup also is one of its famous meals. Its riceballs are moderately salty and the soup is perfect!

column3:
Sweet-tooths line up daily for the handmade strawberry daifuku and other tasty treats at Bakery Cake.
 This much-loved bakery was founded as a nougat shop by a confectioner trained in Switzerland and Japan. To keep up with demand, the bakery has set up three branches. The owner is constantly introducing new treats, but traditional and European breads, puff pastries, flaky pineapple cake, and strawberry daifuku (Japanese mochi filled with adzuki bean paste and a whole strawberry) are the house specialties. High quality, friendly service, and fresh-from-the-oven goodness have earned Bakery Cake a gold-medal reputation.

Connoisseurs of fine dining are guaranteed a delightful culinary experience, contemporary surroundings, and unparalleled views of Taipei City.

During autumn there’s also a rice dumpling. Each one is so fully stuffed, so big that it can’t even fit on a spoon. The skin is chewy and the stuffing is rich. No matter whether it’s the salty pork rice-dumplings, sesame rice-dumplings or peanut rice-dumplings etc, the level of saltiness and sweetness is made to perfection, which is why business is always so good. Especially during the Lantern festival season, there’s always a long line in front of the store. 
No matter whether it’s Taiyi Milk King’s shaved-ice products or rice-dumplings, they are all very popular. Taiyi Milk King always has something delicious to eat throughout the year.

Located in the Gongguan area, this shop is a popular spot for hungry students from nearby National Taiwan University. Taiwanese sandwiches are made from a sliced steamed bun filled with a mix of fat and lean soy stewed meat, cilantro, peanut powder, and pickled Chinese mustard or pickled cabbage. Lan's serves up an especially tasty version of this traditional snack. Make sure to also try the "Four Spirits" soup, made with a concoction of fortifying Chinese medicinal herbs.

Hsu’s Bakery won the innovation award in a pineapple cake competition for its green tea rendition of this traditional sweet. The bakery’s original-flavor pineapple cake, baked to perfectly flaky texture and not too sweet, is another worthwhile treat that will have you coming back for more.
 
 Make sure to save room for Hsu’s famous pancakes, available in milk, flax, egg and Japanese-style varieties. They make a perfect companion with tea and a great gift for home.

Following the traditional Taiwanese cuisine, "Golden Formosa" provides many classic local cuisine like juicy texture Deep-Fried Spare Ribs; rich but not greasy taste of "Steamed Assorted Meats in Chinese Casserole" which follows Fujian cooking skill.
 
 Customers can experience the original taste and flavor of chicken by ordering "Taiwan-Species Chicken". "Golden Formosa" insists to carry forward the feature of Taiwanese cuisine, therefore, becomes the first choice of gourmets.

Integrating the story of the Lords of the Ring and Bali Islan, the Dream of Hobbiton brings people the leisure, happiness and gourmet of the Hobbitons. Eating at this restaurant, customers seem to travel to the exotic world of the Lords of the Ring. Dream of Hobbiton brings you the gourmet dishes and fine wines of the legendary people, who eat six times a day. Consisting of five floors, there is a different theme at each level. Besides, customers can experience, too, the chef’s authentic culinary skills by enjoying those delicate and popular dishes like “Fried Shredded Chicken with Peas”.

In Ji Pin Restaurant, all the top grade shark fins and abalones will be cooked by Mr. Liang, the General Manager of Ji Pin, who learned the cooking from the famous Master Chef Yang of "Ah Yi Abalone Restaurant" in Hong Kong. Just like the "Braised Hokkaido Sea Cucumber and Goose Web with Rich Sauce", one of Mr. Liang's highly recommended specialities, Ji Pin is positioned at luxury seafood market, though people still can get affordable Taiwanese style dishes and great Dim Sum like the most popular "Cantonese Steamed Buns with Salty Egg Yolk and Sweet Butter".

The descendants of Feng Pu’s Jiang family now operate separately in the shops located at Chongqing South Road, Jilin Road and Chongqing North Road, and share the name of the old shop. The treasure of the shop is the business seal of the founder, with “honesty” carved on it, which is the business policy of Feng Pu Tea House. 
To savor a cup of good tea, you have to come to the century-old tea house, Feng Pu Tea House. Feng Pu’s tea leaves, such as Tieguanyin and Dong Ding Oolong, are specially selected from various places, such as Alishan, Hsinchu and Taipei. The product is genuine, reasonably priced and excellent value for money; old friends or new acquaintances are all welcome.

From the south coast of China, Chaochou cuisine style food uses a lot of fresh seafood and special sauces only for certain dishes, and among which, the Marina Goose Slices dish in Chao Ping Ji Restaurant at San Want Hotel Taipei is one of the best. Executive Chef Ho cooks the goose with the aged infusion and paired with the homemade garlic vinegar sauce to serve. Chao Ping Ji also serves Dim Sum style food and special desert menu that will satisfy all gourmands.

Yipin Shanxi Sliced Noodles has earned a loyal following for its delicious, healthy and reasonably priced hand-sliced noodle creations. Founded on Yongkang Street, the restaurant opened a branch in Taipei's Tianmu area in 1997. The specialty of the house is tomato beef noodles made with stewed whole tomatoes and incredibly chewy noodles sliced as you watch by a master of the art. Other popular menu items include old-style noodles with soybean paste, fried meat pies, flaky pancakes, fried shredded pancakes, and chow mein.

column2: Florida Bakery 福利麵包(中山店)
column3:
Founded in Shanghai, Florida Bakery has been in business in Taiwan for a half century. During its early years on the island, the bakery supplied baked goods for US military advisors and later for airlines as well.
 
 Over the intervening decades, the bakery has maintained a faithful clientele and earned top prizes in several bakery good competitions. Florida Bakery's best seller is garlic bread, which can also ordered online.

column2: Dongmen Dumplings 東門餃子館
column3:
Starting out as a hawker around Yongkang Street five decades ago, Dongmen Dumpling is currently operated by the founder’s grandchildren. With the experienced chefs’ relentless improvement efforts, Dongmen is often fully booked despite a seating capacity of up to hundreds of people.
 
 The diverse menu of Dongmen includes dumplings, pot stickers and Northern Chinese cuisine that has continued to lure so many foreigners!
 
 Among Dongmen’s best-sellers, the Pork Dumplings are shredded daikon and pork wrapped in handmade dough; Premium Meat & Leek Dumplings contain refreshingly crispy leek; Veggie Dumplings are non-greasy, and Premium Shrimp Dumplings are lusciously plump; both Hot and Sour Soup and Pork-Seafood Soup are loved by soup connoisseurs; and the Scallion Pancakes have a distinctive aroma. Dongmen’s secret weapons such as the Shredded Chicken Breast and Green Bean Noodles and a colorful range of exclusive side dishes, beef jelly among others, are equally impeccable.

The most popular choices are Golden Horn Pineapple Cake, Oriental Luosong Bread, and Japanese Chiffon Cake that is the same level of deliciousness as those baked in a six star restaurant. During the bluefin tuna season, the head chef presents several creative and tasty dishes using various parts of bluefin tuna.

The reputed dishes are spicy and stewed beef noodle and its beef noodle advertises a Sichuan flavor. The soup spreads light herbs smell, and is heavily spicy. No wonder it won the Taipei beef noodle competition champions in two categories in 2006.

The light and sweet chicken mushroom soup, with huge chicken legs is fresh, tender and delicious. You can even refill your soup bowl for free.The customer’s favorite is sesame red meat soup, which has a thick piece of red meat seasoned with ginger shreds. This is a delicacy you must have during the winter. As for seafood lovers, the boneless milkfish soup is worth your while as well.

column2: Mu Ji Beef Noodles 穆記牛肉麵館
column3:
Legend has it that the beef noodle recipe of this popular establishment was secreted out of the Qing imperial kitchen by a chef who scribbled it on his shirt. Though the story is subject to doubt, there is no question that Mu Ji's beef noodles are fit for a king. The hand-rolled noodles are topped with a generous portion of chewy beef. Both the stewed and braised varieties are sure to satisfy. The restaurant is also known for its beef buns.
Open daily 11:00-21:00

Enjoy the modern, elegant ambiance at Taipei’s trendiest Italian restaurant. Indulge in the essence of Italian cuisine and impeccable service while taking in the breath-taking views of Taipei City.

column3:
Yun Fu Lou Restaurant is one of those oldest Jiangzhe cuisine style Chinese food restaurants in Taipei, but today, its famous dishes are Peking Roasted Duck, Dim Sum, and Japanese style shrimp. Yun Fu Lou provides different dining environment that customers can choose for different occasions, like live piano playing in the general dining room, private rooms with karaoke for small groups, and ballroom for wedding party. The combination of the menu and multi-function of the dining area makes Yun Fu Lou take the lead of modern restaurant operation.

column2: Little Shanghai 小上海
column3:
Little Shanghai's specialty is seafood steamed dumplings with a generous scallop flavor and plenty of fresh and juicy goodness. Other popular selections at Little Shanghai include Chaozhou-style rice tamales (zong-zi) and soy stewed beef noodle soup. The latter is made with a light clear broth and large chunks of tendon beef.
Daily 10:30 to 14:30, 16:30 to 21:00
column4: No. 62, Sec. 4, Minsheng E. Rd., Songshan Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Chin-Chin Garden Restaurant 青青食尚花園會館
column3: In 2011, Chin-Chin launched “Zhishan Waterfront Handmade Taiwanese Delicacies”, a menu-less restaurant that continues the traditional Taiwanese chefs’ pursuit of good taste. Incorporating art into dining, Zhishan Waterfront is expected to continue as a leading brand of sophisticated Taiwanese cuisine!
column4: No. 32, Lane 266, Section 2, Zhishan Rd, Shilin Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Three Coins Restaurant 大三元酒樓
column3:
Three Coins is a multi-purpose restaurant that combines cuisines and tradition in an artistic setting. Despite its inconspicuous, gray-hued exterior, the surprisingly spacious interior of Three Coins oozes elegance with a gold palette, a carefully arranged dining area and visual effects. To ensure customer satisfaction, each table is manned by a member of the large waiting staff to render timely services.
 
 Driven by a persistent pursuit of culinary excellence, the restaurant developed a long-lasting reputation with freshly prepared, modern-style Cantonese dishes and heavenly dim sum based on a mixture of Eastern and Western recipes. The must-try of Three Coins is the papaya and seafood gratin, a half-salty, half-sweet treat made from sweet, small green papaya fruits and rich cheese.
Daily 11:00-14:00, 17:00-21:30
column4: No. 46, Hengyang Rd., Zhongzheng Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Hao Ji Danzih Noodles 好記擔仔麵
column3:
For 16 years, Hao Ji insisted using fresh ingredients instead of frozen ones. Combining Hakka and Taiwanese with other native cooking styles to cook with the sauce prepared with traditional treatment, Hao Ji provides foodies an experience to taste various Taiwanese local cuisines. Just like the hotselling Tainan style "Tan-Tsai Noodles"(also named "peddler noodles"), using 30 kg shrimps and spareribs soup with secret receipt then stirring the minced pork with noodles, can be sold more than 2,000 bowls a day!

column2: Salico Foods 大黑松小倆口
column3:
Made from indigenous pineapples mixed with Australian butter and cream, the brand’s pineapple cakes are baked at high temperatures and contain deliciously visible fruit fibers wrapped in beautifully baked golden crust that is full of rich butter flavor yet tastes non-greasy. Unlike typical pineapple cakes, these moderately sweet yet interestingly sour delicacies offer a solid texture and fruity aroma in each bite!
AM9:30~PM21:00

column3:
11:00-21:30 everyday
Dalai Eatery has not only won the first prize in braised pork rice, but its other dishes have also won praise from food lovers. It is a good choice for simple dining or hosting a banquet. Its dishes include: stuffed eggplant with meat, stewed cabbage with plaice, braised pork trotter, intestine, pig belly, garlic oyster, etc.; other signature dishes such as crispy squid rolls, steamed clam with melon, fried milkfish belly, fried garlic sprouts with dried shrimp, fried Chinese chives with dried shrimp, etc, are just some of the numerous dishes highly recommended. Smart food lovers will let the boss recommend the dishes, and just sit back to enjoy the wonderfully prepared food.

column2: Chiu Ru 九如商號
column3:
This Zhejiang-Jiangsu style restaurant has earned its reputation on authentic glutinous rice dishes, from stir-fried rice cakes and Huzhou meat tamales (zong-zi) to fermented rice dumpling soup. The Huzhou tamales come in sweet (bean paste) and savory (pork) varieties. Chiu Ru is also considered to be the original source of sesame rice dumpling soup in Taiwan. Available in clear and fermented eggy soup varieties, this is a perfect dish to warm you up on a winter day.
Weekdays 09:00 to 21:30; Weekends 09:00 to 21:00

09:00-22:00
The most popular menu items in the shop are: Mat-Cha Ice Cream, Fresh Tea Leaf Tempura, Pu-Erh Beef Noodles, Pouchong Steamed Cabbage, etc. 
Cha For Tea constantly introduces new products, and the latest menu items include: King's Tea Cod and Osmanthus Cake with Cranberry. The restaurant also serves various vegetarian dishes as well as seasonal dishes. Come enjoy a bowl of tea, spend the day with us and forget all of your troubles!

column2: Yang Ji’s Corn and Peanut Ice
column3:
Once you adjust to the idea of corn as a dessert topping, head to Yang Ji's for a cool summer treat. Another popular variety of shave iced dessert sold here is made with boiled peanuts. Try the corn and peanut combo for the full experience.

727 Seafood Restaurant provides delicate Chinese cuisines and insists the "new style of fine food and high quality of crab meal" as their demand.
 
 The specialty "Thai Red Curry Crab" provides bread to soak the amazing and original curry sauce providing customers a whole new experience for "Chinese cuisines used in western way". "Stewed Bamboo and Beef Pot", "Sashimi Combo", and "Chengdu Hot Chili Fish" can satisfy each gourmet’s appetite for fine food

Traditional calligraphy fuses with a modern lighting design to create a timeless aesthetic that complements the artfully prepared dishes, including a regularly updated selection of full course meals. The restaurant's 10 private dining rooms can be reserved for banquet parties of four to 24.

column3:
Founded by a former police squad chief, this Beitou District shop earned fourth place at the 2005Taipei International Newrow Mian Festival. Generous helpings and chewy homemade noodles that soak up the broth flavor have earned Tianpao a loyal following.

column2: Beef Restaurant 牛店牛肉麵
column3:
From its frescoes of cattle to its wood and stone design, Beef Restaurant’s interior design leaves people gaping. Its light soup not only does not have an oily taste, but it possesses an uniquely pleasant aroma. Its signature dish, "Manhan Beef Noodle Soup,” fills your bowl with beef, beef tendon and beef stomach – a portion size certain to leave you satisfied. Those who enjoy strong flavors can add the restaurant’s special spicy beef marrow sauce. Simply delectable! (My Taipei - 2005 Winter)
Tue ~ Sun 11:30-21:00, Closed on Mondays.

column2: A-Cai's Shop 阿才的店
column3: With 50's and 60's movie posters and old pictures on the wall, antique furniture and old Taiwanese music in the air, A-Cai’s Shop not only gives people a :good old time" replica but actually rough and lively dining experience. "Stewed Beef Tendon, Tripe, and Sirloin with Chinese Herbs" is the most popular dish that people always like to try, and people can talk out loudly and eat and drink like a cowboy here. That's the real spirit of the "good old time" in A-Cai's Shop.

column2: Nio Yeh (Beef Boss) Tomato Beef Noodles 牛爺蕃茄牛肉麵店
column3:
Tomato and beef are a perfect match. At Nio Yeh, we bring you beef noodles with a fully cooked tomato and soup base of rich tomato flavor that is sour yet sweet. The tomato flavor further complements the taste of beef, creating an even clearer and sweeter soup base. The best part of having a bowl of tomato beef noodles is its healthy tomato soup base.
 
 Nio Yeh's beef noodles use top-grade imported beef ribs, which are stewed along with various ingredients that give the ribs their rich flavor. Beef ribs are tender but chewy; the combination of the beef ribs and full-bodied ramen noodles has made it the favorite dish of many gourmands and celebrities.
Mon-Fri: 11:00~14:30,16:30~20:30
Sat: 11:00~14:30

column2: Spring Natural Vegetarian Restaurant 春天素食餐廳
column3:
Using natural organic materials, "Spring Natural Vegetarian Restaurant" offers cuisines by buffet and open kitchen style, and gives vegetarian cuisine a new look. Specialties like "Fried Bearded Tooth Mushroom with Wine, Sesame Oil, and Soy Bean", simulated "Shark’s Fin", "King Oyster Mushroom", and "Fried Dumpling" etc, more than a hundred delicacies are provided in Spring Natural Vegetarian Restaurant. Even the non-vegetarians and foreigners will be touched first and then praise profusely when they are dining here.

column2: Beiping Gardens 北平田園餡餅粥
column3:
Serving distinctive and chewy Northern Chinese cuisine, Beiping Gardens is a constant award-winner at the Taipei International Beef Noodles Festival and also a nominee for the City’s Top 10 Popular Restaurants. For three decades, it has attracted government workers around Chongqing South Road with an authentic menu.
 
 Those who love chunky meat will surely be impressed by the chewy yellow beef, with tendons steeped in broth, at the ever-crowded Beiping Gardens. With reasonable prices, this long-established restaurant offers a variety of handmade, traditional Northern Chinese delicacies, such as its signature “Tomato & Beef Noodles” that combines handmade noodles with chunky tendons. The other menu highlights include: vegetarian stuffed pancakes, pancakes sumptuously stuffed with gigantic scallions and beef, exclusive pork dumplings, and millet congee; each delicious dish is full of surprises.
Opening Hours: Mon-Sun 11:00AM-2:00PM; 5:00PM-8:00PM
column4: No. 1, Lane 5, Section 1, Chongqing South Rd., Zhongzheng Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column3:
Located on the first floor of the Grand Formosa Regent Taipei, this buffet style restaurant brings together creative cuisine from around the world. Scrumptious Chinese, western and Japanese dishes vie for your attention, presenting a truly global feast.
Breakfast - 6:30am to 10:00am
Lunch - 11:30am to 2:00pm
Afternoon tea - 2:30pm to 4:30pm
Dinner - 5:30pm to 9:30pm
column4: No. 41, Sec. 2, Zhongshan N. Rd., Zhongshan Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Kenting Dan Dan Bubble Milk Tea 墾丁蛋蛋ㄉㄨㄞ奶
column3:
Standing on a busy street corner near National Taiwan University, Kenting Dan Dan Bubble Milk Tea draws much attention with its funny store name as well as youthful decorative details, including the walls covered in black spots reminiscent of cows. Such creative ideas helped to make it a most distinctive brand image.
 
 Although its competitors mushroomed during the “Pearl Milk Tea craze”, Kenting Dan Dan adopted brown sugar and fresh milk in its recipe, knowing that only those dare to innovate will survive. Rich in calcium, iron and minerals, the low-calorie brown sugar is now a popular beverage ingredient, and the fresh milk provides a natural, tasty source of nutrition. The best-sellers at Kenting Dan Dan not only quench the summer thirst with herbal jelly, mung beans and red beans, but they also ensure good health.
Opening Hours: Sun-Thu, 11:30AM-10:30PM; Fri-Sat 11:30AM-11:30PM
column4: No. 165, Section 3, Tingzhou Rd., Zhongzheng Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column3:
Sichuan-style stewed beef ramen and spicy beef ramen are the best sellers at this long-time establishment. Big servings and low prices have won the shop a loyal clientele, so empty seats are generally hard to find. The spicy beef ramen, made with Chinese cabbage and a sweet, peppery flavor, is a particular favorite of female patrons.
1.Daily 10:00 to 20:00

column3:
A lot of loving care has gone into the sweets and caffeinated pleasures at Balsamo D'Oro. Apart from Italian coffee, the café specialty is cheesecake. Made with high-grade Australian cream cheese, the house cheesecake has a rich flavor and mouth-melting texture that are hard to beat.

column2: Yun-cheng Thai and Myanmar Cuisine 雲城泰緬美食
column3:
The affordable price and nice service are the main features of this restaurant. It emphasizes the original hometown flavor. Specifically, the Myanmar shrimp sauce is hand-made by complex process and inductive so recommended badly.

column3:
Huang Cheng Lang, the chef of Rong Rong Yuan Restaurant, is one of our national top chefs of Zhejiang and Jiangsu cuisines. He is an expert in braised fish and meat cuisines due to decades of cooking experience. "Roast Pork Chop", "Braised Fish Chin", and "Plain Sliced Spreading Chicken" are foodies’ favorite classic dishes; and the traditional "Braised Large Meatballs with Soy Sauce", “Pork Aspic”, “Braised Tilefishes with Tofu”, and “Fried Eel” can furthermore satisfy all customers dining in Rong Rong Yuan.

column3:
"The Dragon" in Sheraton Taipei Hotel is a Cantonese style restaurant which provides classic Cantonese dishes, Hong Kong Dim Sum, and various kinds of succulent seafood.
 
 Delicate "Braised Pork with BBQ Sauce", the pagoda shape side pork with tender and smooth taste, is using deep-fry and complex stew skills. Besides, "Crispy Barbecue Pork", "Cured Meat and Clay-Pot-Cooked Rice", and monthly changed chef’s specially recommendation can all represent The Dragon’s enthusiasm of cuisine.

column2: Zhanlu Coffee 湛盧咖啡
column3:
Daily 12:00-22:00
Zhanlu has a variety of coffees depending on its origins, like Island coffee, African coffee, Asian coffee or American coffee; Italian coffees like espresso, mocha chocolate; various liquor coffee mixes like Bailey’s Irish cream coffee, Orange Wine coffee, Galliano Vanilla Coffee, Irish Whiskey Coffee; Iced mixed coffees like English Blend Iced Coffee, French Lavender Iced Coffee, Athens Violet Iced Coffee, etc. They also serve teas, drinks and desserts. 
Aside from serving delicious coffees, JEANLOOK Coffee, with its beautiful lighting and atmosphere, also hold lectures and free activities. Visitors are welcome to attend and learn things related to coffee.

column2: Chang Nai-miao Memorial Hall 張迺妙茶師紀念館
column3:
Chang Nai-miao was a pioneer tea farmer who had been rewarded by a Japanese governor, he taught residents Baozhong tea planting and imported Tieguanyin in Muzha. Now Chang Nai-miao Memorial Hall is located on the hills.
09:00 - 17:00 (Tue ~ Sun)

column2: Da Sheng Gong Beef Noodle Shop 大聲公牛肉麵
column3:
Also known as "NTU Beef Noodle Shop," this long-time establishment was one of the top-10 picks in an online poll of beef noodle shops in Taipei. The handmade noodles and broth have earned rave reviews, making this a popular haunt for the local student crowd. Among the menu favorites here are the clear broth beef noodles, beef noodles with tendon beef, and half-tendon, half-meat beef noodles. If beef noodles aren't your thing, you can also try the shop's chewy noodles with soybean paste and boiled dumplings.
Daily 11:00 to 15:00, 17:00 to 22:00

column2: Brother Hotel (Plum Blossom Room) 兄弟大飯店-梅花廳
column3:
The Plum Blossom Room of Brother Hotel, a Cantonese restaurant, attracts a loyal customer base and tourists that leave it packed during business hours.
 
 Served on pushcarts in a genuine style of Cantonese High Tea, the colorful dim sum options available at Plum Blossom Room include shrimp dumplings, seafood rolls and crab roe shumai. Among the best-sellers are deep-fried shrimp rolls, rice noodle rolls, roasted cabbage, and juicy seafood-stuffed buns, a must-try.
 
 For those planning to throw banquets, engagement parties, or wedding receptions, the restaurant offers Taiwan abalone with scallops, crab and shark fin stew, lobster, and various other dishes for any desired menu combination.
Daily 09:00-21:30 (dessert available till 20:30)
column4: 2F., No. 255, Sec. 3, Nanjing E. Rd., Songshan Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: The Sweet Dynasty 糖朝(統領概念旗艦店)
column3:
Mon-Fri AM11:00-AM02:00
Sat-Sun AM10:00-AM02:00 (holidays)
Besides desserts, The Sweet Dynasty also serves various signature dishes, snacks, congees and noodles, such as pork ribs with tangerine, fried chicken wings in fermented bean curd, steamed rice-roll with mushrooms and bamboo fungus, barbeque pork bun, Sweet Dynasty fried rice, chicken congee with bird nest and abalone, fermented bean curd pork trotters noodle soup, Sweet Dynasty congee, etc., and there are also frequent seasonal dishes. 
The Sweet Dynasty understands people’s cravings for food; hence, it is open till 2 am in the morning regardless of weekdays or weekends. Whenever you crave supper at night or desserts during the day, you can always come to The Sweet Dynasty to enjoy the sweetness of happiness.
column4: 2F,No. 197, Sec. 4, Zhongxiao E. Rd., Da'an Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Meimen SJT 梅門食踐堂
column3:
The dishes of “Meimen SJT” are prepared meticulously. Every dish has a story behind it, and every recipe is personally prepared by Master Li Feng-Shan, who makes use of seasonal ingredients.
 
 Adhering to the traditional ancient cooking method, and emphasizing yin and yang harmony and the functioning of the five elements, it is intended for easy digestion and body absorption. The only four seasonings used are salt, vinegar, soy sauce and sesame oil, completely presenting the original flavor of the raw ingredients; emphasizing healthy eating through delicacies.
 
 All dishes are named with a cause, and explained by kung fu experts at the scene, allowing customers to savor the delicacies, and let their thoughts carry them to higher levels.
Sun-Thu 11:00-22:00
Fri-Sat 11:00-22:30
Located in the European-style BELLAVITA, “Meimen SJT” fuses the classic with the fashionable, and presents the exquisite and profound history of Chinese dietary culture in a modern style, allowing you to span the barriers of time and space to enjoy the essence of ancient and modern cuisine.
column4: B2, No. 28, Songren Rd., Xinyi Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: Shanghai Court, Hyatt Hotel Taipei 臺北君悅酒店-雲錦中餐廳
column3:
The classic Shanghai cuisines are strongly promoted by Shanghai Court of Hyatt Hotel Taipei; and the chef’s best recommendations will be the "Pot-sticker-like Bean Curd Sheet with Fried Duck and Wild Mushrooms” which uses fried duck and wild mushrooms as fillings to be wrapped by bean curd sheets and tastes both crispy and tender. The other creative dish "Cabbage and Roasted Wheat Glutens Stuffed with Chopped Streaky Pork" is also popular and admirable in Shanghai Court that even if the gourmand will praise it pretty highly.
Daily11:30-14:30；18:00-21:30
column4: 2F., No.2, Songshou Rd., Xinyi Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C

column2: He Feng Restaurant 荷風中國菜
column3:
Based on original recipes like famous Yunnan Style Pot Roasted Beef and homemade ingredients such as salted black beans and shrimp paste, He Feng Restaurant has been well balanced between tradition and healthy food trend in their menu. The owner of He Feng purchases their produce directly from the best farmers to ensure the quality, and selects healthy ingredient like the agave nectar to replace sugar in the Sweet and Sour Pork dish. The way that He Feng inspired the Chinese food makes itself an urban legend in the Taipei city!
Mon.-Sun./Holiday pm11:30-14:00；pm17:30-21:00

column2: The taste of the steppe: Mongolian Fire Pot 草原風蒙古火鍋
column3:
Unlike the soup base of the Japanese or Taiwanese hot pots, our restaurant uses the authentic imperial soup base passed down from Genghis Khan (1162-1227). Made with dozens of natural plants and herbs, the Mongolian soup base combines health foods as well as savory and sweet foods. We offer both spicy and life-preserving hot pots. Although hot pots are also served individually to ensure hygiene, the method of serving is different from the shabu-shabu style of Japan. Along with premium meat and fresh seafood, the Mongolian hot pots are the best choices for reunions or dates. There is also an unlimited supply of hot coffee and cold drinks, floral and herbal tea and ice-cream. The store is located near the MRT Jiantan Station, making it easily accessible.
weekdays 11:30~14:30 17:00~24:00, 
weekend 11:30~22:30

column2: Jio Fong Ji Beef Noodle 雲客來山西刀削麵館 (原名:九豐記牛肉麵)
column3:
The beef noodle soup base is made from beef bone, beef and beef stomach. There is also a variety of noodle dishes and side dishes at great value, including stewed eggs & seaweed, stewed bean curd, pig's ears... and more. They are all just NT$20. Beef noodles are best enjoyed with Taiwanese sauerkraut, which is complimentary. Our signature dishes include roast beef noodles, clear beef noodle soup, beef noodles without soup, and half-beef-tendon noodles, which are all within NT$100. There are also beef offal and roast beef tendon that are offered at good prices for you to enjoy.

Stepping out of the Taipei Metro Kunyang Station and waling into the small alley behind, an aroma that no one can resist is coming from KLE.

column2: Royal Yellow Beef Noodles 皇家黃牛肉麵
column3:
Founded long ago on Boai Rd., Taipei City, Royal Yellow Beef Noodles is currently located on Qingdao E. Rd., and it is frequented by legislators and their aides while also drawing people even from around the world.
 
 The restaurant is best known for half-tendon, half-beef noodles, available braised or stewed. Something irresistible about this specialty is the gem-like luster of beef tendon, combined with chewy noodles and beef prepared with therapeutic Chinese herbs. The flavorful soup stock is either a milky extract from the femoral bones of beef cattle, or a spicily red one infused with Chinese herbs for a non-smelly, non-greasy taste. Chili peppers are available for extra spiciness.
 
 Serving beef noodles in a sanitary setting for 30-plus years, the owner of Royal Yellow Beef Noodles invites you to experience an unforgettable taste that embodies his dedication to a time-honored delicacy.
Daily 11:00~20:30; closed on Chinese New Year holidays
column4: No. 9, Qingdao E. Rd., Zhongzheng Dist., Taipei City Taiwan, R.O.C
